tp:treatment-meta.mixed-citation: Beljaev, Evgeny A., Choi, Sei-Woong & Kuzmin, Aleksandr A. Zaranga pannosa Moore 1884

tp:treatment-sec.tp:nomenclature-citation-list:
Zaranga pannosa Moore, 1884: 357
; TL: “Umballa District” [Ambala district, Haryana state , NW India ].
Zaranga pannosa : Hampson, 1893: 147 , fig. (moth, female); Streltzov & Yakovlev, 2007 , fig. 7 (valva), pl. 2: 1, 2 (moths).
Zaranga pannosa pannosa : Schintlmeister, 2008: 36 : figs 60 (female genitalia), 61 (male genitalia), pl. 2: 15 (moths).
Zaranga pannosa necopinatus Schintlmeister, 2008: 36 : fig. 62 (male genitalia), pl. 2: 15 (moth); TL: Meifiong Prov. Nantou , Taiwan .

tp:treatment-sec.p: Genetic data ( Tab. 1 , Fig. 24 ). Specimen of “ Zaranga tukuringra ” (GenBank accession: LC176123 ) from Yunnan ( China ) possesses the DNA sequences highly distanced from both Z. koreana (4.3–4.5% p-distance) and true Z. tukuringra (5.3–5.7% p-distance), which could assume it belongs to Z. pannosa or another unknown species.
Distribution. Northern Pakistan , North-West India , Nepal ( Z. pannosa pannosa ); Taiwan ( Z. pannosa necopinatus ) ( Schintlmeister 2008 ) ( Fig. 25 ).
